titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1364A
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1364A

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

graphic.desc: By kind permission of British Museum

1.[... ... …] mskb[... ... …] 2.[...ġyl] | w-mḥgrt | w-mr[ʿy ... ... | ḏ-qnyw ... ...] 3.[....]m | w-bny-hw | bn | b[tʿ | ʿdy | mḥrmn | ḏhbn | w-ḥg-n | k-ʿrm | w-ʾḫḏ | kl | hwt | byt=] 4.[n | ...bn]y | btʿ | w-s[ʿd]t[ʾlb | w-mḫṭrn | w-kl | ʾḫy-hw | w-bny-hmw | w-ḏ-ʾʿḏr-hmw | bnw | b=] 5.[tʿ | ... |] whbʾl | yḥz | [mlk | sbʾ | l-ʾdm-hw | bny | btʿ | w-ḥg-n | mśnd | hqny | nš(ʾ)[k]rb | bn |] 6.[... | s]lḥn | f-l | yhmtʿ[n | w-hbrrn | w-hṣḥḥn | w-hṣdqn | w-hwfyn | l-ʾdm-hmw | sʿd=] 7.[tʾlb | ....kl | ʾns]m [| bhṯm | w-qṭnm | ḏ-rḥq | w-qrb | k-ḏ-nmy | wtf | ygbʾnn | l-=] 8.[... ... … … … … … …]

Text preserved in this squeeze:
1.[…] resting-place(?) […] 2.and the reserved land and 3.[….] and his sons of the lineage of [.] 4.[line]age of Bataʿ and Sa[ʿdī]ta[ʾlab] 5.Wahabʾīl Yaḥuz 6.[Sa]lḥīn. And may he protect 7[... ... ... ... ...]
Restored text of the inscription:
1.[…] resting-place(?) […] 2.[the water-course] and the reserved land and [the pastureland of … … which they have acquired … …] 3.[….] and his sons of the lineage of Ba[taʿ in the temple of Dhahabān. And inasmuch as he had cast down and seized that household] 4.[.... the line]age of Bataʿ and Sa[ʿdī]ta[ʾlab and Makhṭarān and all of his brethren and their sons and their descendants among the lineage of Ba-] 5.[taʿ …] Wahabʾīl Yaḥuz, [King of Sabaʾ, for his vassals of the lineage of Bataʿ. And, according to an inscription which Nashaʾkarib bin … had dedicated,] 6.[… Sa]lḥīn. And may he protect [and satisfy and keep healthy and whole and safeguard their vassals Saʿdī-] 7[taʾlab …] all men, big and small, [who are far or near, that (this) document was advanced for them to consent to] 8.[... ... … … … … … …]

div.tei:ab:
Text preserved in this squeeze:
… resting-place? …
and the reserved land and
…. and his sons of the lineage of .
lineage of Bataʿ and Saʿdītaʾlab
Wahabʾīl Yaḥuz
Salḥīn. And may he protect
...
Restored text of the inscription:
… resting-place? …
the water-course and the reserved land and the pastureland of … … which they have acquired … …
…. and his sons of the lineage of Bataʿ in the temple of Dhahabān. And inasmuch as he had cast down and seized that household
.... the lineage of Bataʿ and Saʿdītaʾlab and Makhṭarān and all of his brethren and their sons and their descendants among the lineage of Ba-
taʿ … Wahabʾīl Yaḥuz, King of Sabaʾ, for his vassals of the lineage of Bataʿ. And, according to an inscription which Nashaʾkarib bin … had dedicated,
… Salḥīn. And may he protect and satisfy and keep healthy and whole and safeguard their vassals Saʿdī-
taʾlab … all men, big and small, who are far or near, that this document was advanced for them to consent to
… … … … … …
